term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - continuous wave (CW) laser
term.title: continuous wave (CW) laser

item.text: CW operation of a laser means that the laser is continuously pumped and continuously emits electromagnetic radiation. The emission can occur in a single cavity mode or on multiple modes.

notes.item: Some lasers are called CW mode-locked. This indicates that the pulse average power is constant, i.e., there is no Q-switched mode locking.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 318 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
